common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch crash due to AVX2 requirement
common_issues.description: PiecesOS version 11.1.1 introduced a new vector library requiring AVX2 support, causing launch crashes for users with older CPUs lacking this feature. The issue affected Windows and macOS users. The Pieces team acknowledged the problem and released a patch in version 11.1.2 to address the dependency, resolving the issue for affected users.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS crash immediately after launch
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After upgrade PiecesOS to version 11.1..1 it crashes every time immediately after launch. Previous version worked well. Attached is the crash report log.

Environment: 

- OS MacOS 15.2
- CPU Intel 

[trace.log](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18777512/trace.log)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User `gonzososa` reported an issue launching PiecesOS on their system.
* The issue is related to the new vector library requiring AVX2 support, which is not available on older CPUs.
* `gonzososa` provided information about their CPU (Intel Core i5-3210M).
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and mentioned they are working on a fix.

**Problems identified:**

* PiecesOS was unable to launch due to the new vector library requiring AVX2 support.
* This impacted users with older CPUs that lacked AVX2 support.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces team developed a solution to address the AVX2 issue.
* They released a new version (11.1.2) of the application with the fix.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been resolved with the release of version 11.1.2.
* User `gonzososa` confirmed that the fix works for them.

**Additional notes:**

* This issue is related to another issue (#620) where users reported similar problems with the application.
* The Pieces team actively engaged with the users and provided updates on the progress of the fix.

related_issues.title: Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
related_issues.text:
Pieces os doesn't launch at all for past week. Can't use pieces at all
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

For the past week, anytime that I launch pieces I see this: 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/61f18fb6-8846-46d8-8747-5c415fd2e82d)

Pieces OS just doesn't open, no matter what.

I tried to reinstall everything, but also no progress.

How to fix it? (Also to mention, Pieces desktop app is in Early Access program, but I don't know if this information is useful)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: 

**Key points raised:**

- User (@GetReal444) reported an issue with booting up PiecesOS.
- The error message seems to be related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension and AVX2 support.
- User provided logs and a screenshot of their tech specs.

**Problems identified:**

- The CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension requires AVX2 which is not supported on some processors.
- This issue affects multiple users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- The Pieces team is actively working on a solution.
- They released a patch in version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS to address the dependency issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The user confirmed that the latest version (11.1.2) resolved the issue for them.

**Additional notes:**

- The team is monitoring the situation and will provide updates as needed.
- Users experiencing similar issues should update to the latest version of PiecesOS.

## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS not launching (11.1.1)

**Key points raised:**

* PiecesOS version 11.1.1 has issues launching for some users.
* Users are experiencing problems across different platforms (Windows, possibly others).
* The issue seems to be related to stricter hardware requirements.

**Problems identified:**

* User frustration due to inability to launch PiecesOS.
* Potential loss of productivity and inconvenience for users.
* Negative impact on user experience.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team is actively investigating the issue and working on a patch.
* Users are encouraged to provide support logs for troubleshooting.
* A patch release is expected within 24-48 hours (as of Feb 11, 2025).
* A mitigation release is planned for Feb 13, 2025.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Patch released as PiecesOS version 11.1.2 on Feb 14, 2025.
* Users are encouraged to update and report any further issues.
* The issue appears to be resolved with the latest update.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of user feedback in identifying and resolving software issues.
* The Pieces team is responsive and working diligently to address the problem.

**Overall, the situation is improving, and the Pieces team is committed to ensuring a smooth user experience.**

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch failure and slow startup
common_issues.description: Users reported PiecesOS failing to launch or experiencing slow startups, often encountering errors related to core dependencies. This issue affected various operating systems and PiecesOS versions. Proposed solutions included updating to the latest version (11.1.2), reinstalling the application, and addressing potential conflicts with OneDrive.

related_issues.title: Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
related_issues.text:
Cannot launch pieces-for-developers after new installation on MacOS Sequoia 15.2 M1 chip
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I cannot install pieces Desktop App, or it fails to run.  I originally reported this by email on 9 Jan 2025, and the response email referred to an existing issue on github #546.  However this issue now seems closed, hence I am raising it here as a new bug.
 
I have recently installed pieces OS on my Mac with a package dmg.  The pieces OS appears to install, and I see the icon in the top bar.  Pieces appears to connect to the cloud successfully, and I can install plugins for Intellij, VSCode and Obsidian.  These are visible within the pieces OS icon at the top.  
 
Pieces appears to work from IDE plugins.   However I cannot launch the Desktop App, and ‘launch pieces for developers’ from the top Pieces menu fails silently.

I have recently upgraded Pieces OS, now on 11.1.1
 
Info:
 
Mac OS: Sequoia 15.2
Chip: Apple M1 Pro
 
Pieces OS: 11.1.1 (was installed as 11.0.3(
Pieces desktop app – won’t install
Pieces OS seems to be running in ‘activity monitor’
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* PASimmons was unable to launch PiecesOS on their M1 Mac.

**Problems identified:**

* Incorrect build for the M1 chip was installed.
* Potentially conflicting processes were running.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Mark suggested:
    * Killing the `pieces_qdrant_server` process.
    * Providing `com.pieces.os` support logs.
    * Reinstalling Pieces for developers and PiecesOS using the correct build for the M1 chip.
* PASimmons reinstalled Pieces for developers using the Apple Silicon download link.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is resolved. 
* PASimmons confirmed that Pieces for developers is now running fine.
* Mark announced the resolution and linked to a related issue #615. 

**Additional Information:**

* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the proper team member.
* Mark provided calendar link for real-time debugging.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: PiecesOS Takes a While to Boot-up (Cannot Run)

**Key Points Raised:**

* **Issue:** PiecesOS takes a long time to boot up and often gets stuck, displaying an error message about failing to ensure core dependencies in the Desktop Application.
* **Affected Users:** Multiple users reported the issue, including on Windows and macOS.
* **Potential Causes:**
    * Possible bug in the application installer.
    * Conflict with OneDrive.
    * Outdated processor (pre-2015).
* **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
    * Update to version 11.1.1.
    * Uninstall and reinstall the app.
    * Manually install the app using the appInstaller build.
    * Remove the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive.
    * Update to version 11.1.2.
* **Current Status/Outcome:**
    * The issue seems to be resolved for most users who updated to version 11.1.1 or 11.1.2.
    * Some users, including rogierlegit, are still experiencing issues.

**Problem Identified:**

The issue appears to be related to a bug in the application installer, a conflict with OneDrive, or an outdated processor.

**Solution Implemented:**

Updating to the latest version of PiecesOS (11.1.2) seems to have resolved the issue for most users. Additionally, removing the com.pieces.os folder from OneDrive and using the appInstaller build may have helped some users.

**Current Status:**

The issue seems to be resolved for most users. However, some users are still experiencing issues and require further assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of providing detailed information about the issue, including screenshots and logs.
* The PiecesOS team was responsive and actively engaged in resolving the issue.
* It is important to note that the information provided is based on the available conversation and may not represent all cases.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch due to core dependency errors
common_issues.description: Users are reporting PiecesOS failing to launch, getting stuck on "Ensuring Core Dependencies" during startup. This issue appears across macOS and Windows platforms. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest version (11.1.2 or higher), reinstalling the app, and removing the 'com.pieces.os' folder from OneDrive if applicable.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Fails to Launch After Update
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to launch after updating, often getting stuck on "ensuring core dependencies." This issue appears across operating systems and versions, potentially due to installer bugs, OneDrive conflicts, or hardware limitations. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest version (11.1.2), reinstalling the app, manually installing using the appInstaller build, and removing the 'com.pieces.os' folder from OneDrive.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS fails to launch due to extension error
common_issues.description: Multiple users reported PiecesOS failing to launch on versions 11.1.1. The error message pointed to a "DatabaseException" related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension. This was caused by a dependency on AVX2 instruction sets not supported on all CPUs. The Pieces team released a patch in version 11.1.2 to address this issue.

related_issues.title: Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
related_issues.text:
Facing error on Ubuntu while opening Pieces "DatabaseException"
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Faccing "DatabaseException(Unable to load 'CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch' extenstion" (1), code : can'tOpenFile)" on my ubuntu desktop 
## GitHub Issue Summary: Pieces App Boot Up Issue

**Key Points:**

* User @Rohit0072 reported an issue where the Pieces app was not booting up.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to the relevant team.
* The user was provided with helpful resources and related issues.
* @tsavo-at-pieces identified the issue as related to other reported issues (#620, #624, and #625).
* A fix was expected to be released by the end of the next day (February 13th, 2025).

**Problems Identified:**

* The Pieces app was not booting up for the user.
* This issue was affecting multiple users.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* A fix was identified and was expected to be released on February 13th, 2025.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user was advised to update to the latest version of PiecesOS (11.1.2) to see if the issue was resolved.
* The outcome of the update is not mentioned in the conversation.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place between February 9th, 2025 and February 14th, 2025.
* The user was offered additional support through a calendar link and email address.

- The error message seems to be related to the "CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch" extension and AVX2 support.
- User provided logs and a screenshot of their tech specs.

**Problems identified:**

- The CouchbaseLiteVectorSearch extension requires AVX2 which is not supported on some processors.
- This issue affects multiple users.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

- The Pieces team is actively working on a solution.
- They released a patch in version 11.1.2 of PiecesOS to address the dependency issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

- The user confirmed that the latest version (11.1.2) resolved the issue for them.

**Additional notes:**

- The team is monitoring the situation and will provide updates as needed.
- Users experiencing similar issues should update to the latest version of PiecesOS.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS was unable to launch.
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS was unable to launch.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

latest

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7a6a7957-5aa1-4d53-b492-cf4470aa5edc)
## GitHub Issue Summary: PiecesOS not launching (11.1.1)

**Key points raised:**

* PiecesOS version 11.1.1 has issues launching for some users.
* Users are experiencing problems across different platforms (Windows, possibly others).
* The issue seems to be related to stricter hardware requirements.

**Problems identified:**

* User frustration due to inability to launch PiecesOS.
* Potential loss of productivity and inconvenience for users.
* Negative impact on user experience.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces team is actively investigating the issue and working on a patch.
* Users are encouraged to provide support logs for troubleshooting.
* A patch release is expected within 24-48 hours (as of Feb 11, 2025).
* A mitigation release is planned for Feb 13, 2025.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Patch released as PiecesOS version 11.1.2 on Feb 14, 2025.
* Users are encouraged to update and report any further issues.
* The issue appears to be resolved with the latest update.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of user feedback in identifying and resolving software issues.
* The Pieces team is responsive and working diligently to address the problem.

**Overall, the situation is improving, and the Pieces team is committed to ensuring a smooth user experience.**

recommendations: "Prioritize resolving PiecesOS launch issues affecting versions 11.1.1 and earlier, specifically addressing AVX2 dependency and core dependency errors during startup."
"Investigate and address the root cause of slow startup times and high resource usage reported in PiecesOS, particularly in versions prior to 11.1.2."
"Review and improve the PiecesOS installer to prevent issues related to OneDrive conflicts and ensure smooth updates."
"Consider providing clearer communication and documentation regarding PiecesOS hardware and software requirements to manage user expectations and minimize compatibility issues."
